metadata.title: CVE-2020-15682 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
When a link to an external protocol was clicked, a prompt was presentedthat allowed the user to choose what application to open it in. An attackercould induce that prompt to be associated with an origin they didn'tcontrol, resulting in a spoofing attack. This was fixed by changingexternal protocol prompts to be tab-modal while also ensuring they couldnot be incorrectly associated with a different origin. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 82.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-geckodriver - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-mozsymbols - 82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '82.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
